qas.question: What is another term for the Umayyads?
Traditionally, who did the Umayyads and Muhammad both descend from?
From what city did the Umayyads originate?
What son of Abd-Shams was the ancestor of the Umayyads?
Who did Abd Manaf ibn Qusai descend from?
Who suspects that Muhammad was an adopted son?
Which historians agree with the Muslim Shia historians?
Who was married to the grandson of Abdullah bin Amr bin Uthman?
Who was the grandson of Zaid bin amr bin uthman bin affan?

context: According to tradition, the Umayyad family (also known as the <a0_0>Banu Abd-Shams<a0_0/>) and <b4_0>Muhammad<b4_0/> both descended from a common ancestor, <a1_0>Abd Manaf ibn Qusai<a1_0/>, and they originally came from the city of <a2_0>Mecca<a2_0/>. Muhammad descended from Abd Manāf via his son Hashim, while the Umayyads descended from Abd Manaf via a different son, Abd-Shams, whose son was <a3_0>Umayya<a3_0/>. The two families are therefore considered to be different clans (those of Hashim and of Umayya, respectively) of the same tribe (that of the Quraish). However <b5_0>Muslim Shia historians<b5_0/> suspect that Umayya was an adopted son of Abd Shams so he was not a blood relative of Abd Manaf ibn Qusai. Umayya was later discarded from the noble family. <b6_0>Sunni<b6_0/> historians disagree with this and view Shia claims as nothing more than outright polemics due to their hostility to the Umayyad family in general. They point to the fact that the grand sons of Uthman, Zaid bin amr bin uthman bin affan and <b8_0>Abdullah bin Amr bin Uthman<b8_0/> got married to the Sukaina and <b7_0>Fatima<b7_0/> the daughters of Hussein son of Ali to show closeness of Banu hashem and Bani Ummayah.
